intro: Stenogrammitis aethiopica, commonly known as the Ethiopian moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rock surfaces or in forest understories. The plant has a simple structure with a thallus that is often covered in a layer of green or yellowish cells. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature. Stenogrammitis aethiopica plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
